description: A free tool to write, share and export a data management plan. Instance aimed at Belgian researchers with built-in data management plan templates for the major funders.

description: Data management planning tool

name: DS-Wizard
description: Data Stewardship Wizard

description: Data, model and SOPs management for projects, from preliminary data to publication, support for running SBML models etc. (public SEEK instance)

name: fairsharing
description: A curated, informative and educational resource on data and metadata standards, inter-related to databases and data policies.

name: GitHub
description: Versioning system, used for sharing code, as well as for sharing of small data

name: Phyre2
description: Protein Homology/analogY Recognition Engine

name: MIAPPE
description: Minimum Information About a Plant Phenotyping Experiment

name: maDMP - Research Bridge
description: Machine-Actionable Data Management Plan | Webinar (2016) on making a good data management plan.

name: Research Management Plan
description: Machine actionable DMPs.

name: iRODS
description: Integrated Rule-Oriented Data System (iRODS) is open source data management software for a cancer genome analysis workflow.

name: SEEK
description: Data, model and SOPs management for projects, from preliminary data to publication, support for running SBML models etc.
tags: collect, process, analyse, share, preserve, storage, privacy

name: The Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC)
description: Minimum Information about any (x) Sequence

name: ArrayExpress
description: ArrayExpress is a database of functional genomics experiments

name: BioModels
description: BioModels is a repository of computational models of biological processes

name: BioSamples
description: The BioSamples database aggregates sample information for samples for which data exist in one of the ELIXIR's assay databases

name: BioStudies
description: The BioStudies database holds descriptions of biological studies, links to data from these studies in other databases at EMBL-EBI or outside, as well as data that do not fit in the structured ELIXIR archives.

name: EMDB
description: The Electron Microscopy Data Bank (EMDB) is a public repository for electron microscopy density maps of macromolecular complexes and subcellular structures

name: EVA
description: The European Variation Archive is an open-access archive that accepts submission of, and provides access to, all types of genetic variation data from all species.

name: IntAct
description: IntAct provides a freely available, open source database system and analysis tools for protein interaction data.

name: Metabolights
description: MetaboLights is a database for metabolomics studies, their raw experimental data and associated metadata.

name: PRIDE
description: The PRIDE PRoteomics IDEntifications database is a centralized, standards compliant, public data repository that provides protein and peptide identifications together with supporting evidence.

name: PDBE
description: The Protein Data Bank in Europe (PDBe) is the European resource for the collection, organisation and dissemination of data on biological macromolecular structures.

name: EGA
description: The European Genome-phenome Archive (EGA) allows you to deposit and explore datasets from molecular studies on human subjects

name: ENA
description: The European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) servs both as the database of record for the output of the world's sequencing activity and as a platform for the management, sharing and publication of sequence data.

name: ISA-tools
description: Open source framework and tools helping to manage a diverse set of life science, environmental and biomedical experiments using the Investigation Study Assay (ISA) standard

name: MCPD
description: The Multi-Crop Passport Descriptor is the metadata standard for plant genetic resources maintained ex situ by genbanks.

name: FAIDARE
description: FAIDARE is a tool allowing to search data across dinstinct databases that implemented BrAPI.

name: Crop Ontology
description: The Crop Ontology compiles concepts to curate phenotyping assays on crop plants, including anatomy, structure and phenotype.

name: DATAVERSE
description: Open source research data respository software.

name: ONTOMATON
description: OntoMaton facilitates ontology search and tagging functionalities within Google Spreadsheets.

name: ADA-M
description: The Automatable Discovery and Access Matrix (ADA-M) provides a standardized way to unambiguously represent the conditions related to data discovery and access.

name: Beacon
description: The Beacon protocol defines an open standard for genomics data discovery.

name: Data Use Ontology
description: DUO allows to semantically tag datasets with restriction about their usage.

name: Informed Consent Ontology
description: The Informed Consent Ontology (ICO) is an ontology for the informed consent and informed consent process in the medical field.

name: Privacy Impact Assessment Tool
description: Privacy Impact Assessment Tool is a software, that allows you to carry out Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) independently.

name: BBMRI-ERIC's ELSI Knowledge Base
description: The ELSI Knowledge Base is an open-access resource platform that aims at providing practical know-how for responsible research.

name: DAWID
description: The Data Agreement Wizard is a tool developed by ELIXIR-Luxembourg to facilitate data sharing agreements.

name: EUPID
description: EUPID provides a method for identity management, pseudonymisation and record linkage to bridge the gap between multiple contexts.

name: RD-Connect Genome Phenome Analysis Platform
description: The RD-Connect GPAP is an online tool for diagnosis and gene discovery in rare disease research.
tags: human data, privacy, share, re-use, analyse

name: GA4GH data security toolkit
description: Principled and practical framework for the responsible sharing of genomic and health-related data.

name: dbGAP
description: The database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) archives and distributes data from studies investigating the interaction of genotype and phenotype in Humans
tags: human data, privacy, share, re-use, storage

name: BRENDA
description: Database of enzyme and enzyme-ligand information, across all taxonomic groups, manually extracted from primary literature and extended by text mining procedures

name: RDA Standards
description: Directory of standard metadata, divided into different research areas

name: CATH
description: A hierarchical domain classification of protein structures in the Protein Data Bank.

name: ChEBI
description: Dictionary of molecular entities focused on 'small' chemical compounds

name: ChEMBL
description: Database of bioactive drug-like small molecules, it contains 2-D structures, calculated properties and abstracted bioactivities.

name: Ensembl
description: Genome browser for vertebrate genomes that supports research in comparative genomics, evolution, sequence variation and transcriptional regulation.

name: Ensembl Genomes
description: Comparative analysis, data mining and visualisation for the genomes of non-vertebrate species

name: Europe PMC
description: Europe PMC is a repository, providing access to worldwide life sciences articles, books, patents and clinical guidelines.

name: Human Protein Atlas
description: The Human Protein Atlas contains information for a large majority of all human protein-coding genes regarding the expression and localization of the corresponding proteins based on both RNA and protein data.

name: Data Curation Centre Metadata list
description: List of metadata standards

name: MINT
description: MINT, the Molecular INTeraction database, focuses on experimentally verified protein-protein interactions mined from the scientific literature by expert curators

name: InterPro
description: Functional analysis of protein sequences by classifying them into families and predicting the presence of domains and important sites

name: Orphadata
description: The Orphadata platform provides the scientific community with comprehensive, high-quality datasets related to rare diseases and orphan drugs, in a reusable and computable format

name: Silva
description: SILVA provides comprehensive, quality checked and regularly updated datasets of aligned small (16S/18S, SSU) and large subunit (23S/28S, LSU) ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences for all three domains of life (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukarya).

name: STRING
description: Known and predicted protein-protein interactions.

name: UniProt
description: Comprehensive resource for protein sequence and annotation data
